com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen

Class DigitalPenManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen.DigitalPenManager

  • public class DigitalPenManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Snapdragon DigitalPenManager communicates settings to the Snapdragon Digital Pen service on the device and has methods for registering listeners for events and side-channel data from the digital pen.

    • The minimum Android API level is 17.
    • Not all devices will have Snapdragon Digital Pen functionality. Query isFeatureSupported(Feature) for DigitalPenManager.Feature.BASIC_DIGITAL_PEN_SERVICES to verify.

    Settings are changed at run-time by acquiring a DigitalPenManager.Settings object, modifying it then calling DigitalPenManager.Settings.apply().

    Multiple applications may use the Snapdragon Digital Pen SDK. Settings are reset to system default when the application is paused, and restored when the application resumes.

    Development Flow

    • Query for capability of device. Call isFeatureSupported(Feature) for DigitalPenManager.Feature.BASIC_DIGITAL_PEN_SERVICES to check if the device has the Snapdragon Digital Pen feature enabled.
    • Create a new DigitalPenManager object.
    • Call getSettings() to get the settings interface.
    • Change the desired setting, e.g., DigitalPenManager.Settings.setOffScreenMode(DigitalPenManager.OffScreenMode)
    • Apply settings changes with DigitalPenManager.Settings.apply()

    Usage 

     // in your class's activity...
 protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
     // boilerplate ...
     super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
     setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

     // To use the Snapdragon Digital Pen service...
     DigitalPenManager mgr = new DigitalPenManager(getApplication());
     Settings settings = mgr.getSettings();
     settings.setOffScreenMode(OffScreenMode.EXTEND)
             .setOnScreenHoverEnabled()
             .apply();
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DigitalPenManager.Area
      Describes areas around the device.
      static interface  DigitalPenManager.BackgroundSideChannelCanceledListener
      The listener interface for receiving notification that a side-channel listener has been canceled.
      static interface  DigitalPenManager.BatteryStateChangedListener
      The listener interface for receiving Battery State Changed events, which indicate the battery is low or OK.
      static class  DigitalPenManager.Feature
      The features that can be queried through isFeatureSupported(Feature)
      static interface  DigitalPenManager.MicBlockedListener
      The listener interface for receiving micBlocked events, which indicate that the number of blocked microphones has changed.
      static class  DigitalPenManager.OffScreenMode
      How the off-screen mode will operate
      static interface  DigitalPenManager.OnSideChannelDataListener
      Used when registering listeners for side-channel data, i.e., data points that bypass the Android input framework.
      static interface  DigitalPenManager.PowerStateChangedListener
      The listener interface for receiving Power State Changed events, which indicate the framework has changed power state.
      class  DigitalPenManager.Settings
      The Settings class is the interface to settings in the Snapdragon Digital Pen service.
      static class  DigitalPenManager.SideChannelData
      This data is returned through listeners upon receiving pen events.
      static class  DigitalPenManager.SideChannelMapping
      Describes how the X/Y/Z coordinates in the side-channel callback are represented

        public DigitalPenManager(Application application)

    • Method Detail

      • isFeatureSupported

        public static boolean isFeatureSupported(DigitalPenManager.Feature feature)
        Returns true if the feature is available and false if it is not.
        Parameters:
        feature - the DigitalPenManager.Feature being checked.
        Returns:
        true if feature is supported

      • releaseApplication

        public boolean releaseApplication()
        Release the connection with the Snapdragon Digital Pen service. The digital pen settings will revert to the system default.

      • getSettings

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings getSettings()
        Returns the DigitalPenManager.Settings interface which is used to modify and query settings.
        Returns:
        the settings interface

      • registerSideChannelEventListener

        public void registerSideChannelEventListener(DigitalPenManager.Area area,
                                    DigitalPenManager.OnSideChannelDataListener listener)
        Register side channel event listener. This sets the callback for when side channel events are received, but doesn't enable the side channel. To enable the side channel itself, set its mapping with DigitalPenManager.Settings.setSideChannelMapping(DigitalPenManager.Area, DigitalPenManager.SideChannelMapping)
        Parameters:
        area - the area to listen for side-channel events
        listener - the listener that will be called for each event

      • unregisterSideChannelEventListener

        public void unregisterSideChannelEventListener(DigitalPenManager.Area area)
        Unregister side channel event listener. Platform must support DigitalPenManager.Feature.SIDE_CHANNEL. This only unregisters the listener. To disable the side-channel, call DigitalPenManager.Settings.setSideChannelMapping(DigitalPenManager.Area, DigitalPenManager.SideChannelMapping) with DigitalPenManager.SideChannelMapping.DISABLED.
        Parameters:
        area - the area from which to unregister the listener.

      • getOffScreenDisplay

        public Display getOffScreenDisplay()
        Returns the Snapdragon Digital Pen off-screen Display handle. This is the virtual display that's available for user input when selecting DigitalPenManager.OffScreenMode.EXTEND.
        Returns:
        the off-screen display

      • setMicBlockedListener

        public void setMicBlockedListener(DigitalPenManager.MicBlockedListener listener)
        Sets the mic blocked listener. This is called whenever the number of microphones detected to be blocked changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - the new mic blocked listener, or null to unregister.

      • setPowerStateChangedListener

        public void setPowerStateChangedListener(DigitalPenManager.PowerStateChangedListener listener)
        Sets the listener for Power State Changed events. This is called whenever the power state of the framework changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - the power state changed listener, or null to unregister.

      • setBatteryStateChangedListener

        public void setBatteryStateChangedListener(DigitalPenManager.BatteryStateChangedListener listener)
        Sets the listener for Battery State Changed events. This is called whenever the battery state changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - the battery state changed listener, or null to unregister.

      • setBackgroundSideChannelCanceledListener

        public void setBackgroundSideChannelCanceledListener(DigitalPenManager.BackgroundSideChannelCanceledListener listener)
        Sets the listener for when background side-channel listeners are canceled. This can happen if another application tries to use the DigitalPenManager while this application is listening in background.
        Parameters:
        listener - the background side channel canceled listener, or null to unregister.

      • logVersions

        public static void logVersions()
        Causes DigitalPenManager to log the current version information for the Snapdragon DigitalPenManager and Snapdragon Digital Pen service via logcat.
